intro: Hieracium canitiosum, commonly known as the silver hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium canitiosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
